column4: Hmm. I'm trying to install ubuntu 8.10. The cd boots up fine, I get to chose to install it. I gest stuck and thrown into BusyBox built-in shell (ash)
What could be the problem?
may be rootsystem not found
And how would I make the installer find it? :)
you can look with mount wether it is mountet under /root/yourroutsystem
rootfs on /
one reason could be not the driver for the filesystem used
It's a empty new disk
I had the case, when i started an existing installation
usually you have an error-message, when you come to busybox
Yeah, No controller found.
you boot from a CD?  you can try options like failsafe
Yeah, I do. I'll try to see if there are any booting options
Safe graphics mode or use driver update cd?
it it's a hw-recognition problem you may avoid some tests, for example with acpi, but I have no Idea what controler it misses...
may be the hard-disk controller, may be there is a module missing
Yeah, I guessed. I tried searching google.. but I can't seem to find someone with the same problem + computer model. It's a shuttle sd37p2
I guess it can be. I did boot up gparted before at least. So there should be a driver for it
ah gparted worked...
I guess I have to do some sort of custon like usb installer to get stuff working?
you can install an ubuntu on a usb-Stick... and boot from there
Yeah, I meant.. I wold need the disk driver on it tho? Otherwise I would get the same problem
differnt drives have differnt drivers I guess,  but it's difficult to say
I remember an app that prepares the usb stick with a boot image.. somewhere on sourceforge.. you remember the name?
